Class DctCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • DctCalculator

  • public final class DctCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    DctCalculator This class can be used to track the changing matrix sparsity for an image that is being modified. With this DCT calculator, the total matrix sparsity only needs to be calculated once. When modifying the image, the potential new value can be estimated by only looking at the pixels in the block around the modified pixel. This is a lot faster than calculating the total sparsity value for the whole image again

    • Constructor Detail

      • DctCalculator

        public DctCalculator(int dctBlockSize,
                     int[][] matrix)
        Create a new DCT calculator.
        Parameters:
        dctBlockSize - The size for the DCT blocks
        matrix - The matrix containing pixel values of the input image

    • Method Detail

      • tryModification

        public double tryModification(int xCoordinate,
                              int yCoordinate,
                              int newColorValue)
        This method is used to try out a modification of a pixel, to test what the new matrix sparsity would be.
        Parameters:
        xCoordinate - The x coordinate in the pixel matrix
        yCoordinate - The y coordinate in the pixel matrix
        newColorValue - The new color value for pixel (x, y)
        Returns:
        the estimated new sparsity with this modification

      • performModification

        public void performModification()
        This method will be called if the last tested modification was good enough, and should be saved. This method updates the variables because the image has been updated.

      • testEstimatedSparsitySoFar

        public void testEstimatedSparsitySoFar()
        This method test can be used to check if the matrix sparsity so far has been estimated well. It calculates the total matrix sparsity of the image, and compares it to the estimated sparsity.

      • getTotalSparsity

        public double getTotalSparsity()
        Get the total sparsity calculated so far.
        Returns:
        the total sparsity
